trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The spider can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Web Sense
entries: While in contact with a web, the spider knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

trait.name: Web Walker
entries: The spider ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

trait.name: Ethereal Awareness
entries: The Shadow Spider can see ethereal creatures and objects and interact with them

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the shadow spider has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Movement of prey
entries: Wen a Shadow Spider carries a creature it has {@condition grappled}, its movement speed is not halved

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shadow Spider spins a Web of Shadow and may make a bite attack or a grapple attempt.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}21 ({@damage 4d6 + 7}) piercing damage plus {@h}39 ({@damage 6d12}) poison damage, and the target must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, or be {@condition stunned} until the end of their next turn.

action.name: Web of Shadow
entries: The spider spins a Web of Shadow in a space within 5 feet of it. The area is filled with magical darkness, and darkvision cannot see through this darkness. Whenever a creature enters the Web for the first time on a turn or begins its turn there, it take {@damage 6d12} necrotic damage and must make a {@dc 20} wisdom saving throw or be {@condition frightened} until the end of their next turn

To snare its prey, a giant spider spins elaborate webs or shoots sticky strands of webbing from its abdomen. Giant spiders are most commonly found underground, making their lairs on ceilings or in dark, web-filled crevices. Such lairs are often festooned with web cocoons holding past victims.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The naga is a 10th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (spell save {@dc 19}, {@hit 11} to hit with spell attacks), and it needs only verbal components to cast its spells. It has the following wizard spells prepared:

trait.name: Rejuvenation
entries: If it dies, the naga returns to life in {@dice 1d6} days and regains all its hit points. Only a {@spell wish} spell can prevent this trait from functioning.

trait.name: Nightmare Gaze
entries: When a creature that can see the Nightmare Naga's eyes starts its turn within 30 feet of the Nightmare Naga can force it to make a {@dc 25} Wisdom saving throw if the Nightmare Naga isn't {@condition incapacitated} and can see the creature. A creature that fails the save it {@condition frightened} and restained. The {@condition restrained} creature must repeat the saving throw at the end of its next turn, becoming {@condition petrified} on a failure or ending the effect on a success. The certification lasts until the creature is freed with a greater restoration or other magic.

A creature can close its eyes to avoid the saving throw at the start of its turn. A creature {@condition restrained} by a nightmare gaze does not have this option. If the creature opens its eyes in the meantime, it must immediately make the save.

The Nightmare Naga is immune to its own gaze unless it sees itself reflected in the mirror of Semith, in which case it must make the saving throw and cannot use Legendary Resistance to make the save. If it fails, it is immediately {@condition petrified} until greater restoration or similar magic ends the condition.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the nightmare naga fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one creature. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage plus 39 ({@damage 6d12}) necrotic damage

Spirit nagas live in gloom and spitefulness, constantly plotting vengeance against creatures that have wronged them-or that they believe have wronged them. Lairing in dismal caverns and ruins, they devote their time to developing new spells and enslaving the mortals with which they surround themselves. A spirit naga likes to charm its foes, drawing them close so that it can sink its poisonous fangs into their flesh.

entries.name: Nagas
entries: Nagas are intelligent serpents that inhabit the ruins of the past, amassing arcane treasures and knowledge.

The first nagas were created as immortal guardians by a humanoid race long lost to history. When this race died out, the nagas deemed themselves the rightful inheritors of their masters' treasures and magical lore. Industrious and driven, nagas occasionally venture out from their lairs to track down magic items or rare spellbooks.
Nagas never feel the ravages of time or succumb to sickness. Even if it is struck down, a naga's immortal spirit reforms in a new body in a matter of days, ready to continue its eternal work.

entries.name: Benevolent Dictators and Brutal Tyrants
entries: A naga rules its domain with absolute authority. Whether it rules with compassion or by terrorizing its subjects, the naga believes itself the master of all other creatures that inhabit its domain.

entries.name: Rivalry
entries: Nagas have a long-standing enmity with the yuan-ti, with each race seeing itself as the epitome of serpentine evolution. Though cooperation between them is rare, nagas and yuan-ti sometimes set aside their differences to work toward common objectives. However, yuan-ti always chafe under a naga's authority.

entries.name: Immortal Nature
entries: A naga doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Reckless
entries: At the start of its turn, the berserker can gain advantage on all melee weapon attack rolls during that turn, but attack rolls against it have advantage until the start of its next turn.

trait.name: Rage
entries: The Tormented berserker has advantage on all strength checks and saving throws, and is immune to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions

trait.name: Retaliation
entries: When the Tormented Berserker take damage from a creature within 5 feet of it, it may use its reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature

trait.name: Danger sense
entries: The Tormented Bersker has advantage on dexterity saving throws against effects it can see

trait.name: Lair Action
entries: On initiative count 20 and initiative count 10, the portal casts Vortex Warp on any tormented Berserker in the theater.

trait.name: Rage Beyond Death
entries: While it's raging, having 0 hit points doesn't knock it {@condition unconscious}. It suffers the normal effects of taking damage while at 0 hit points. However, if it would die due to failing death saving throws, it doesn't die until rage ends, and it dies then only if you still have 0 hit points.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Tormented Berserker makes 2 attacks with its greataxe and a thrid with it's bonus action if availible

action.name: Magical Greataxe (+3, Quasimagical Shadow Mythallar)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 16} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}31 ({@damage 1d12 + 10}) slashing damage.
Hailing from uncivilized lands, unpredictable berserkers come together in war parties and seek conflict wherever they can find it.

trait.name: Limited Magic Immunity
entries: The Shadow General is unaffected by spells of 5th level or lower. The Shadow General has advantage on saving throws and ability checks against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Life Eater
entries: A creature dies if reduced to 0 hit points by the Shadow General and can't be revived except by a {@spell wish} spell.

trait.name: Unusual Nature
entries: The Shadow General doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (5/Day)
entries: If the shadow general fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Shadow General makes a Slam attack, and uses Finger of Doom, if available.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning plus 13 ({@damage 3d8}) cold damage. A creature hit by a slam attack is knocked back 40ft

action.name: Finger of Doom {@recharge}
entries: The Shadow General points at one creature it can see within 300 feet of it. The target must succeed on a {@dc 24} Wisdom saving throw or take 26 ({@damage 4d12}) necrotic damage and become {@condition frightened} until the end of the General's next turn. While {@condition frightened} in this way, the creature is also {@condition paralyzed}. If a target's saving throw is successful, the target is immune to the General's Finger of Doom for the next 24 hours.

fluff.name: Nightwalker
entries: The Negative Plane is a place of death, anathema to all living things. Yet there are some who would tap into its fell power and use its energy for sinister ends. Most individuals prove unequal to the task. Those not destroyed outright are sometimes drawn inside the plane and replaced by nightwalkersâ€”terrifying Undead creatures that devour all life they encounter.

One can reach the Negative Plane from the Shadowfell in places where the barrier between the planes is thin. Stepping onto the Negative Plane is almost always fatal since the plane sucks the life and soul from creatures, annihilating most at once. The few who survive by sheer luck or by harnessing some rare form of protective magic soon discover that they can't leave as easily as they arrived. Worse, for each creature that enters the plane, a nightwalker is released to take its place. In order for a trapped creature to escape, the released nightwalker must be lured back to the Negative Plane by offerings of life for it to devour. If the nightwalker is destroyed, the trapped creature has no hope of escape.

Generally, a nightwalker on the Material Plane is attracted to elements of the world associated with the creature responsible for its creation, which can provide clues as to who the trapped creature is. This attraction doesn't indicate a willingness to engage with the world, though; nightwalkers exist to make life extinct, and they prioritize anything associated with the trapped creature for destruction.

legendary.name: Slam
entries: The Shadow General Makes a slam attack

legendary.name: Shadow Step
entries: If in dim light or darkness, the Shadow General may teleport up to 60 feet to another area of dim light or darkness.

legendary.name: Dispel
entries: The Shadow General Casts dispel magic, using intelligence as its casting ability score

monster.name: Avatar of Shar, Mistress of the Night The Nightbringer Nightsinger Singer of Eternal Night Dark Lady Dark Goddess Lady of Loss Goddess of Loss Mistress of Pain God of Thieves Greater Power of the Gray Waste

entries: Summoned by the "Skull" card from the {@item Deck of Many Things}.

trait.name: Magic Immunity
entries: Shar can't be affected or detected by spells of 9th level or lower unless it wishes to be. It has advantage on saving throws against all other spells and magical effects.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (At Will)
entries: If the shar fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: God of the dark
entries: The avatar uses implosion or warp reality.
Afterwards, the Avatar of Shar replaces any demons that are no longer in the the theatre
Shadow Demons -> Nalfesnee
Nalfeshnee -> Marilith
Marilith -> Balor
Balor ->  2x Balor
All Demons go at initiative count 17

action.name: Warp Reality
entries: The Avatar of Shar may teleport any demons from anywhere in the theatre to anywhere else in the theatre.

action.name: Implosion
entries: The Avatar of Shar selects one demon in the theatre to return to its demonic essence, rendering it eligible for replacement.
